alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 23 at 4:46AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over southern parts of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, western San Miguel. This includes southern parts of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. * WHEN...Until 845 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams, creeks and normally dry arroyos can be expected due to vulnerable drainage basins near and downstream of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern portions of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar area, including Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Tecolote, Mineral Hill, San Geronimo, San Pablo, Gallinas and Ojitos Frios. - This includes the following highways... State Road 518 near Mile Marker 1. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 335 and 340. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. This includes the following recreation areas... E.V. Long Campground and El Porvenir Campground.
info.instruction: Avoid low water crossings and be alert to rising water levels in creeks, washes, arroyos and streams.
